direction.raw_text: 'For June, who loved this garden -- from Joseph who always sat beside her.' We cut in and see an inscription carved into the wood.  She doesn't read the dates, carved below -- 'June Wetherby, 1917 - 1992.'  She is slightly chocked by it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some people do spend their whole lives together. He nods.  They are standing on either side of the bench, looking at each other.  The camera glides away from them, up into the night sky, leaving them alone in the garden.  Music plays. INT. WILLIAM'S LIVING ROOM - EVENING William in a towel rushes downstairs, having just had a shower. He shoots past Spike.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bollocks, bollocks, bollocks.  Have you seen my glasses?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, 'fraid not.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bollocks. (still searching -- with no help from Spike) This happens every time I go to the cinema.  Average day, my glasses are everywhere -- everywhere I look, glasses.  But the moment I need them they disappear.  It's one of life's real cruelties.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's compared to, like, earthquakes in the Far East or testicular cancer?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh shit, is that the time?  I have to go. INT. WILLIAM'S LIVING ROOM/CORRIDOR - EVENING He sprints downstairs, now fully dressed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (not meaning it) Thanks for your help on the glasses thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (sincerely) You're welcome.  Did you find them?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sort of. INT. CINEMA - NIGHT Mid-film.  We move across the audience.  And there is in the middle of it, we see Anna, watching the screen, and next to her, William, watching the film keenly, through his scuba- diving goggles. INT. RESTAURANT - NIGHT A very smart Japanese restaurant.  We see Anna and William sitting, near the end of their meal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So who left who?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She left me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She saw through me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh-oh.  That's not good. We've been aware of the conversation at a nearby table -- now we can hear it.  Two slightly rowdy men.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No - No- No!  Give me Anna Scott any day. William and Anna look at each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't like that last film of hers. Fast asleep from the moment the lights went down. Again -- Anna reacts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't really care what the films are like.  Any film with her in it -- fine by me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No -- not my type at all really.  I prefer that other one -- blonde -- sweet looking -- has an orgasm every time you take her out for a cup of coffee. Anna mouths 'Meg Ryan.'
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meg Ryan. William and Anna smile -- they're enjoying it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Drug-induced, I hear -- I believe she's actually in rehab as we speak.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whatever, she's so clearly up for it. Anna's twinkle fades.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know -- some girls, they're all 'stay away chum' but Anna, she's absolutely gagging for it.  Do you know that in over fifty percent of languages the word for "actress" is the same as the word for "prostitute." This is horrible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And Anna is your definitive actress -- someone really filthy you can just flip over...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right, that's it. He gets up and goes round the corner to the men.  There are in fact four of them, the two meeker men, Gavin and Harry, hanging on the other guys' witty words.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry to disturb you guys but -- LAWRENCE Can I help you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, yes, I wish I hadn't overheard your conversation -- but I did and I just think, you know... He's not a very convincing or frightening figure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...the person you're talking about is a real person and I think she probably deserves a little bit more consideration, rather than having jerks like you drooling over her...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh sod off, mate.  What are you, her dad? Anna suddenly appears at his side and whips him away without being recognized.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, that's fine.  I love that you tried... time was I'd have done the same. They walk on and then...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In fact -- give me a second. And she walks straight back to their table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh my God...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry about my friend -- he's very sensitive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, look, I'm sorry...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please, please -- let's just leave it there.  I'm sure you meant no harm, and I'm sure it was just friendly banter and I'm sure you dicks are all the size of peanuts.  A perfect match for the size of your brains.  Enjoy your meal.  The tuna's really good. And she walks away.  Gerald turns to Lawrence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You prick. EXT. RITZ ARCADE - NIGHT They are walking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I shouldn't have done that.  I shouldn't have done that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, you were brilliant
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm rash and I'm stupid and what am I doing with you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know, I'm afraid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know either. They have arrived at the end of the arcade.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here we are. (pause) Do you want to come up?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (he hoes) There seem to be lots of reasons why I shouldn't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There are lots of reasons.  Do you want to come up? His look says yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Give me five minutes. He watches her go -- and stands in the street.  Music plays. INT. RITZ CORRIDOR/ANNA'S SUITE - NIGHT William coming along the hotel corridor.  He knocks on the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hiya. There's something slightly awry.  He doesn't notice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi. He kisses her gently on the cheek.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To be able to do that is such a wonderful thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (pause) You've got to go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because my boyfriend, who I thought was in America, is in fact in the next room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your boyfriend? He is duly shocked.  She's trying to be calm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Who is it? Jeff drifts into view behind.  He is a very famous film star and looks the part -- well built, very handsome.  Unshaven, he has magic charm, whatever he says.  Over a t-shirt, he wears a shirt, which he unbuttons as he talks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ahm... room service.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How you doing?  I thought you guys all wore those penguin coats.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, yes -- usually -- I'd just changed to go home -- but I thought I'd just deal with this final call.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh great.  Could you do me a favour and try to get us some really cold water up here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll see what I can do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Still, not sparkling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Absolutely.  Ice cold still water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Unless it's illegal in the UK to serve liquids below room temperature: I don't want you going to jail just to satisfy my whims...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I'm sure it'll be fine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And maybe you could just adios the dishes and empty the trash.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right. And he does just that.  Scoops up the two used plates and heads to the bin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really -- don't do that -- I'm sure this is not his job.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry.  Is this a problem?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah -- no.  It's fine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's your name?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ahm... Bernie. Jeff slips him a fiver.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you, Bernie. (to Anna) Hey -- nice surprise, or nasty surprise?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nice surprise. He kisses her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Liar. (to William) She hates surprises.  What are you ordering?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I haven't decided.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, don't over-do it.  I don't want people saying, 'There goes that famous actor with the big, fat girlfriend." He wanders off taking off his t-shirt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I better leave. Anna just nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: this is a fairly strange reality to be faced with.  To be honest, I don't realize...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry... I don't know what to say.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think goodbye is traditional. INT. RITZ CORRIDOR - NIGHT William walks away. EXT. RITZ - NIGHT William walks down the arcade outside the hotel.  He is stunned. EXT. LONDON BUS - NIGHT William sits alone on a bus.  We see him through the side window.  As it drives away, we see that the whole back of the bus is taken up with a huge picture of Anna. INT. WILLIAM'S BEDROOM - NIGHT He gets into his room and sits on the bed. INT. SPACESHIP - NIGHT Space Anna, in the very hi-tech environment and a serious moods, fastens the last clasps on her uniform.  She takes a helmet type thing, and places it on her head. INT. CONNECT CINEMA - NIGHT Cut round to the Coronet cinema where this film is showing. It's not full.  The camera moves and finds, sitting on his own...William.  Just watching.  We see a momentous flash of light from the screen explode, reflected in his eye. INT. WILLIAM'S LIVING ROOM - EVENING William is looking out the window, lost in thought.  Spike enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on -- open up -- this is me -- Spikey -- I'm in contact with some quite important spiritual vibrations. What's wrong? Spike settles on the arm of a chair.  William decides to open up a bit...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, okay.  There's this girl...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aha!  I'd been getting a female vibe. Good.  Speak on, dear friend.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's someone I just can't -- someone who... self-evidently can't be mine -- and it's as if I've taken love-heroin -- and now I can't even have it again. I've opened Pandora's box.  And there's trouble inside. Spike nods thoughtfully.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeh.  Yeh... tricky... tricky... I knew a girl at school called Pandora ... never got to see her box though. He roars with laughter.  William smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks.  Yes -- very helpful. INT. TONY'S RESTAURANT - NIGHT Only two tables are being used.  William and his friends are on their first course.  Bernie reads an "Evening Standard," with a picture of Anna and Jeff at Heathrow Airport.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You didn't know she had a boyfriend?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No -- did you? Their looks make it obvious that everyone did.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bloody hell, I can't believe it -- my whole life ruined because I don't read 'Hello' magazine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's face facts.  This was always a no-go situation.  Anna's a goddess and you know what happens to mortals who get involved with the gods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Buggered?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Every time.  But don't despair -- I think I have the solution to your problems.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really? They all look to him for wise words.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Her name is Tessa and she works in the contracts department.  The hair, I admit, is unfashionable frizzy -- but she's as bright as a button and kisses like a nymphomaniac on death row.  Apparently. INT. MAX AND BELLA'S KITCHEN/LIVING ROOM - NIGHT The kitchen.  William is looking uneasy.  A doorbell rings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now -- try. William nods.  Max heads off to the door.  We stay with William -- and just hear the door open and a voice come down the corridor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) I got completely lost -- it's real difficult, isn't it?  Everything's got the word 'Kensington' in it -- Kensington Park Road, Kensington Gardens, Kensington bloody Park Gardens... They reach the kitchen.  Tessa is a lush girl with huge hair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tessa -- this is Bella my wife.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh hello, you're in a wheelchair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's right.

direction.raw_text: And this is William.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (frightened) Has he?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wine?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh yes please.  Come on, Willie, let's get sloshed. She turns to take the wine and William has a split second to send a message of panic to Bella.  She agrees -- it's bad. INT. MAX AND BELLA'S KITCHEN/CONSERVATORY - NIGHT Max walks over to the table.  Honey, Bella, William and another girl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Keziah -- some woodcock?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, thank you  -- I'm a fruitarian.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't realize that. It is left to William, who has been set up here, to fill the pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And ahm -- what's a fruitarian exactly?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We believe that fruits and vegetables have feelings so we think cooking is cruel.  We only eat things that have actually fallen from the tree or bush -- that are, in fact, dead already.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right.  Right.  Interesting stuff. (pause) So these carrots...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have been murdered, yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Murdered?  Poor carrots.  How beastly. INT. MAX AND BELLA'S CONSERVATORY - NIGHT Time for coffee and chocolates.  Beside William sits the final, perfect girl.  She is Rosie, quite young, smartly dressed, open-hearted.  It is just Max and William and Bella and her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Delicious coffee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you.  I'm sorry about the lamb.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No -- I thought it was really, you know, interesting.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really inedible -- yes that's right. They all laugh.  It's going very well. INT. MAX AND BELLA'S CORRIDOR - NIGHT William is with Rosie by the door -- just about to say goodbye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe we'll meet again some time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.  That would be... great. She kisses him gently on the cheek.  He opens the door -- she walks out.  He shuts the door quietly and heads back into the living room... INT. MAX AND BELLA'S LIVING ROOM - NIGHT Max and Bella wait excitedly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's perfect, perfect.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And? William makes a gentle, exasperated gesture, then...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think you have forgotten... (he looks at them) what an unusual situation you have here -- to find someone you actually love, who'll love you -- the chances are... always miniscule.  Look at me -- not counting the American -- I've only loved two girls in my whole life, both total disasters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's not fair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No really, one of them marries me and then leaves me quicker than you can say Indiana Jones -- and the other, who seriously ought to have known better, casually marries my best friend.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (pause) Still loves you though.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In a depressingly asexual way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (pause) I never fancied you much actually... They all roar with laughter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I mean I loved you -- you were terribly funny.  But all that kissing my ears...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh no -- this is just getting worse. I am going to find myself, 30 years from now, still on this couch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you want to stay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why not -- all that awaits me at home is a masturbating Welshman. Music starts to play to take us through these silent scenes. INT. MAX AND BELLA'S LIVING ROOM - NIGHT Max lifts Bella off her couch and carries her upstairs. Mix through -- William sits on the couch downstairs -- eyes wide open -- thinking. INT. MAX AND BELLA'S KITCHEN/LIVING ROOM - DAY Morning.  Max, all in his suit for the city... Bella kisses him goodbye.  William sees this from the kitchen.  She is also dressed for work -- and moves back into the kitchen to pack her briefcase with law books from the kitchen table. EXT. MAX AND BELLA'S HOUSE - DAY William emerges from the house, a little ruffled from a night away from home, a heads off. EXT. NEWSAGENT - DAY William walks past the newsagent, heading for home.  We see, though he doesn't, a rack of tabloid papers, all of which seem to have very grainy, grabbed pictures of Anna on their front page.  Headlines --'Anna Stunna'-- 'It's Definitely Her!' and 'Scott of Pantartica.' INT. WILLIAM'S BATHROOM - DAY William is shaving.  The bell goes.  He heads out to answer it. EXT./INT. WILLIAM'S HOUSE -DAY William arrives at the door and opens it.  There stands a dark- glassed Anna.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi.  Can I come in?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come in. She moves inside.  Her hair is a mess -- her eyes are tired. Nothing idealized. INT. LIVING ROOM - DAY The two of them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They were taken years ago -- I know it was... well, I was poor and it happens a lot -- that's not an excuse -- but to make things worse, it now appears someone was filming me as well.  So what was a stupid photo- shoot now looks like a porno film. And well... the pictures have been solid and they're everywhere. William shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know where to go.  The hotel is surrounded.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is the place.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you.  I'm just in London for two days -- but, with your papers, it's the worse place to be. She's very shaken.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: These are such horrible pictures. They're so grainy... they make me look like...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't think about it.  We'll sort it out.  Now what would you like -- tea ... bath...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A bath would be great. INT. WILLIAM'S CORRIDOR - DAY Spike enters through the front door.  William doesn't hear him. Spike is reading newspapers with the Anna pictures in it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Christ alive... brilliant... fantastic .... magnificent... He heads up the stairs.  Opens the bathroom door, walks in. INT. WILLIAM'S BATHROOM - DAY Spike heads for the toilet -- undoes his zip...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You must be Spike. She's in the bath.  Spike turns in shock -- and sidles out of the bathroom. INT. WILLIAM'S CORRIDOR - DAY Spike calms himself down.  He then opens the bathroom door again -- and looks in. INT. WILLIAM'S BATHROOM - DAY Anna is still lying low in the bath.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just checking. INT. CORRIDOR - DAY Spike comes back out into the corridor.  Looks to heaven.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you, God. INT. WILLIAM'S KITCHEN - DAY William and Anna at the kitchen table, eating toast, dringking tea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm really sorry about last time.  He just flew in -- I had no idea -- in fact, I had no idea if he'd ever fly in again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, that's fine.  It's not often one has the opportunity to adios the plates of a major Hollywood star.  It was a thrill for me. (she smiles.  Pause) How is he?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know.  It got to the point where I couldn't remember any of the reasons I loved him.  And you... and love?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, there's a question -- without an interesting answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have thought about you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh no no -- no. He doesn't think she has to talk about this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just anytime I've tried to keep things normal with anyone normal -- it's been a disaster.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I appreciate that absolutely. (changing subject tactfully) Is that the film you're doing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes -- start in L.A. on Tuesday.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you like me to take you through your lines?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you?  It's all talk, talk, talk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hand it over.  Basic plot?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm a difficult but brilliant junior officer who in about twenty minutes will save the world from nuclear disaster.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well done you. EXT. TERRACE - DAY A little later.  They're in the thick of the script.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'Message from command.  Would you like them to send in the HKs?'
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'No, turn over 4 TRS's and tell them we need radar feedback before the KFT's return at 19 hundred -- then inform the Pentagon that we'll be needing black star cover from ten hundred through 12.15' -- and don't you dare say one word about how many mistakes I made in that speech or I'll pelt you with olives.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'Very well, captain -- I'll pass that on straightaway.'
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'Thank you.'  How many mistake did I make?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eleven.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Damn.  'And Wainwright...'
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cartwright.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'Cartwright, Wainwright, whatever your name is, I promised little Jimmy I'd be home for his birthday -- could you get a message through that I may be a little late.'
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'Certainly.  And little Johnny?'
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My son's name is Johnny?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yup.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, get a message through to him too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brilliant. (the scene's over) Word perfect I'd say.

direction.raw_text: What do you think?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gripping.  It's not Jane Austen, it's not Henry James, but it's gripping.

direction.raw_text: You think I should do Henry James instead?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sure you'd be great in Henry James. But, you know -- this writer's pretty damn good too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes -- I mean -- you never get anyone in 'Wings of a Dove' having the nerve to say 'inform the Pentagon that we need black star cover.'
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And I think the book is the poorer for it. Anna smiles her biggest smile of the day.  He is helping. INT. WILLIAM'S DINING ROOM Anna and William.  Sat down at table.  There's a picture hanging on the wall behind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't believe you have that picture on your wall. It is a poster of a Chagall painting of a floating wedding couple, with a goat as company.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You like Chagall?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I do.  It feels like how being in love should be.  Floating through a dark blue sky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With a goat playing a violin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes -- happiness wouldn't be happiness without a violin-playing goat. Spike enters with three pizzas.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Voila.  Carnival Calypso, for the Queen of Notting Hill -- pepperoni, pineapple and a little more pepperoni.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fantastic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't mention that Anna's a vegetarian, did I?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (pause) I have some parsnip stew from last week. If I just peel the skin off, it'll be perfect. INT. WILLIAM'S LIVING ROOM - NIGHT Later in the evening.  William and Anna on their own.  They're sipping coffee.  A few seconds of just co-existing.  Anna looks up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've got big feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.  Always have had.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know what they say about men with big feet?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.  What's that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Big feet -- large shoes. He laughs. INT. WILLIAM'S LIVING ROOM - NIGHT A few hours later -- eating ice-cream out of the tub.

direction.raw_text: The thing that's so irritating is that now I'm so totally fierce when it comes to nudity clauses.

direction.raw_text: You actually have clauses in your contact about nudity?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Definitely.  'You may show the dent at the top of the artist's buttocks -- but neither cheek.  In the event of a stunt person being used, the artist must have full consultation.'

direction.raw_text: You have a stunt bottom?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I could have a stunt bottom, yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you be tempted to go for a slightly better bottom than your own?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But yesterday... that actor asked you who I was... and you just dismissed me out of hand... I heard -- you had a microphone... I had headphones.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You expect me to tell the truth about my life to the most indiscreet man in England? Martin edges up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me -- it's your mother on the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you tell her I'll ring her back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I actually tried that tack -- but she said you said that before and it's been twenty-four hours, and her foot that was purple is now a sort of blackish color...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay -- perfect timing as ever -- hold the fort for a second will you, Martin? Martin is left with Anna.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I just say, I thought 'Ghost' was a wonderful film.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes... I've always wondered what Patrick Swayze is like in real life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't say I know Patrick all that well.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh dear.  He wasn't friendly during the filming?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, no -- I'm sure he was friendly -- to Demi Moore -- who acted with him in 'Ghost.' She's kind in here, not sarcastic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh right.  Right.  Sorry.  Always been a bit of an ass. William returns a little uneasy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anyway... it's lovely to meet you.  I'm a great fan of yours.  And Demi's, of course. Martin leaves them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry about that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's fine.  There's always a pause when the jury goes out to consider its verdict. She's awaiting an answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anna.  Look -- I'm a fairly level- headed bloke.  Not often in and out of love.  But... He can't really express what he feels.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... can I just say 'no' to your kind request and leave it at that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Yes, that's fine.  Of course.  I... you know... of course... I'll just... be getting along then... nice to see you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The truth is... He feels he must explain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... with you, I'm in real danger.  It took like a perfect situation, apart from that foul temper of yours -- but my relatively inexperienced heart would, I fear, not recover if I was once again ... cast aside, which I would absolutely expect to be.  There are too many pictures of you everywhere, too many films.  You'd go and I'd be... well, buggered, basically.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I see. (pause) That reality is a real 'no,' isn't it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I live in Notting Hill.  You live in Beverly Hills.  Everyone in the world knows who you are.  My mother has trouble remembering my name.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay.  Fine.  Fine.  Good decision. Pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The fame thing isn't really real, you know.  Don't forget -- I'm also just a girl.  Standing in front of a boy. Asking him to love her. Pause.  She kisses him on the cheek.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bye. Then turns and leaves.  Leaving him. INT. TONY'S RESTAURANT - DAY The restaurant is in the middle of being deconstructed.  The pictures are gone off the walls -- a kettle on a long extension lead is on the bare table behind.  They're all sitting there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you think?  Good move?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good move: when all is said and done, she's nothing special.  I saw her taking her pants off and I definitely glimpsed some cellulite down there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good decision.  All actresses are mad as snakes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tony -- what do you think?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Never met her, never want to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brilliant.  Max?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Absolutely.  Never trust a vegetarian.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Great.  Excellent.  Thanks. Spike enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was called and I came.  What's up?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: William has just turned down Anna Scott.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You daft prick! Bella is casually looking at the painting that sits beside William.  It is the original of the Chagall, the poster of which was on his wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This painting isn't the original, is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, I think that one may be.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But she said she wanted to go out with you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes -- sort of...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's nice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, you know, anybody saying they want to go out with you is... pretty great... isn't it...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was sort of sweet actually -- I mean, I know she's an actress and all that, so she can deliver a line -- but she said that she might be as famous as can be -- but also... that she was just a girl, standing in front of a boy, asking him to love her. They take in the line.  It totally reverses their attitudes. A pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh sod a dog.  I've made the wrong decision, haven't I? They look at him.  Spike does a big nod.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Max, how fast is your car? EXT. TONY'S RESTAURANT - DAY Max's car arrives in the street outside.  They pile into the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If anyone gets in our way -- we have small nuclear devices.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And we intend to use them!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's Bella?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's not coming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sod that.  Bernie -- in the back! He shoots out of his door, rushes round and grabs Bella out of the chair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, babe. EXT./INT. CAR. STANLEY CRESCENT/NOTTING HILL GATE - DAY Max's car is shooting up Stanley Crescent.  We are inside and outside the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where are you going?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Down Kensington Church Street, then Knightsbridge, then Hyde Park Corner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Crazy.  Go along Bayswater...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's right -- then Park Lane.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Or you could go right down to Cromwell Road, and left.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No! Suddenly the car slams to a halt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop right there!  I will decide the route.  All right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: James Bond never has to put up with this sort of shit. EXT. PICCADILLY - DAY The car turns illegally right across Piccadilly the wrong way down a one-way street and ends up outside the Ritz.  William sprints into the hotel.  Bernie follows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bloody hell, this is fun. IT. RITZ LOBBY - DAY WILLIAM Is Miss Scott staying here? It is the same man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How about Miss Flintstone?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Or Bambi... or, I don't know, Beavis or Butthead? Man shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right.  Right.  Fair enough.  Thanks. He turns despondent and takes two steps when the Ritz Man stops him in his tracks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There was a Miss Pocahontas in room 126 -- but she checked out an hour ago.  I believe she's holding a press conference at The Savoy before flying to America. William is very grateful.  He kisses the Ritz Man.  Bernie's also gratuful.  He kisses him too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have lift off!! A Japanese guest assumes this is the way to behave and the Ritz Man gets kissed a third time. EXT. LONDON STREET - DAY The car speeds through London.  It gets totally stuck at a junction where no one will let them in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bugger this for a bunch of bananas. He gets out of the car and boldly stops the traffic coming in the opposite direction.  Our car shoots past him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go! They leave him behind.  Honey leans out the window and shouts...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're my hero. Spike waves wildly -- he loses concentration and is very nearly hit by a car. EXT. THE SAVOY - DAY They pull to a stop.  William leaps out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go! INT. THE SAVOY - DAY William rushes up to the main desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me, where's the press conference?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you an accredited member of the press?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes... He flashes a card.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's a Blockbuster video membership card, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's right... I work for their in- house magazine. (mimes quotation marks) 'Movies are our business.'
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry, sir... Honey shoots into shot, pushing Bella's chair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's with me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you are?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Writing an article about how London hotels treat people in wheelchairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course, madam.  It's in the Lancaster Room.  I'm afraid you're very late.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to William) Run! INT. SAVOR ROOM - DAY William runs, searching.  At last finds the room, and enters. INT. LANCASTER ROOM - DAY Huge room -- full of press.  Row after row of journalists, cameras at the front, TV cameras at the back.  Anna clearly gives press conferences very rarely, because this one is positively presidential.  She sits at a table at the end of the room, beside Karen: on her other side is Jeremy, the PR boss, firmly marshalling the questions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes... You -- Dominic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How much longer are you staying in the UK then?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No time at all.  I fly out tonight. She's in a slightly melancholic and therefore honest mood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Which is why we have to round it up now. Final questions. He points at a journalist he knows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is your decision to take a year off anything to do with the rumours about Jeff and his present leading lady?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Absolutely not.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you believe the rumours?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's really not my business any more. Though I will say, from my experience, that rumours about Jeff... do tend to be true. They love that answer, and all scribble in their note books. Next question comes from someone straight right next to William.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Last time you were here, there were some fairly graphic photographs of you and a young English guy -- so what happened there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He was just a friend -- I think we're still friends.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, the gentleman in the pink shirt. He is pointing straight at William, who has his hand up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes -- Miss Scott -- are there any circumstances in which you two might be more than just friends? Anna sees who it is asking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hoped there might be -- but no, I'm assured there aren't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And what would you say...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, it's just one question per person.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, let him... ask away.  You were saying?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, I just wondered whether if it turned out that this... person...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to William) His name is Thacker.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks.  I just wondered if Mr. Thacker realized he'd been a daft prick and got down on his knees and begged you to reconsider, whether you would... reconsider. We cut to Max, Bella, Bernie and Honey, all watching.  Then back to Anna.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, I'm pretty sure I would.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's very good news.  The readers of 'Horse and Hound' will be absolutely delighted. Anna whispers something to Jeremy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dominic -- if you'd like to ask your question again?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes -- Anna -- how long are you intending to stay here in Britain? Pause.  Anna looks up at William.  He nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Indefinitely. They both smile -- suddenly the press gets what's going on -- music -- noise -- they all turn and flash, flash, flash photos of William.  Max and Bella kiss.  Bernie kisses a total stranger. Spike finally makes it -- he's bright red from running.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happened?
direction.name: direction
